questiontext.text:
Example

Write down the form of the Fourier series and expressions for the coefficients if

  1. \(T = 2l\)
  2. \(T = \dfrac{2\pi}{\omega}\)

Solution

  1. \( f(t) = \dfrac{a_0}{2} + \sum _{n = 1} ^\infty \left\{ a_n\cos \left( \dfrac{n\pi t}{l}\right) + b_n \sin\left( \dfrac{n\pi t}{l}\right) \right\} \)

    with

    \( a_n = \dfrac{1}{l} \displaystyle{ \int _{-l} ^l } f(t) \cos \left( \dfrac{n\pi t}{l} \right) \hspace{0.15cm} dt \)

    and similarly for \(b_n\).

  2. \( f(t) = \dfrac{a_0}{2} + \sum _{n = 1} ^\infty \left\{ a_n\cos \left( n\omega t \right) + b_n \sin\left( n\omega t \right) \right\} \)

    with

    \( a_n = \dfrac{\omega}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{-\frac{\pi}{\omega}} ^{\frac{\pi}{\omega}} } f(t) \cos \left( n\omega t \right) \hspace{0.15cm} dt \)

    and similarly for \(b_n\).

You should note that, as usual, any convenient integration range of length \(T\) (or \(2l\) or \( \dfrac{2\pi}{\omega}\) ) can be used in evaluating \(a_n\) and \(b_n\).
